states.description: Mixed waste pile containing: plastic bottles, paper, cardboard, metal cans, food-stained paper, and a plastic-coated cardboard container. Four bins labeled: Paper, Plastic, Metal, Contaminated/Trash.
Plastic bottles and metal cans separated. Paper and the plastic-coated cardboard container remain in the mixed waste pile. Food-stained paper is also still in the pile.

Plastic bottles in Plastic bin. Metal cans in Metal bin. Remaining in the mixed waste pile: Paper and plastic-coated cardboard container, plus food-stained paper. A paper item is mistakenly placed in the Metal bin.

Plastic bottles in Plastic bin. Metal cans in Metal bin. Paper correctly separated into Paper bin. The plastic-coated cardboard container is now recognized as 'Contaminated'. Food-stained paper sorted as contaminated. The paper item, mistakenly in the Metal bin, is being corrected.

Plastic bottles in Plastic bin. Metal cans in Metal bin. Paper correctly sorted in Paper bin. Plastic-coated cardboard container and food-stained paper in Contaminated/Trash bin. The paper item, removed from the Metal bin, is ready to be re-sorted.

Plastic bottles in Plastic bin. Metal cans in Metal bin. Paper correctly sorted in Paper bin. Plastic-coated cardboard container and food-stained paper in Contaminated/Trash bin. The misclassified paper is in the Paper bin.

Plastic bottles in Plastic bin. Metal cans in Metal bin. Paper in Paper bin. Plastic-coated cardboard container and food-stained paper in Contaminated/Trash bin. All items correctly sorted. Final inspection in progress.

Plastic bottles in Plastic bin. Metal cans in Metal bin. Paper in Paper bin. Plastic-coated cardboard container and food-stained paper in Contaminated/Trash bin. All items correctly sorted and no contamination. Task completed.

actions.description: Separate plastic bottles and metal cans from the mixed waste pile.
Place plastic bottles into Plastic bin and metal cans into Metal bin. Begin sorting the remaining paper, cardboard and food stained items.
Identify and begin the correct handling of the plastic-coated cardboard container by classifying it as contaminated. Also classify food stained paper as contaminated and move paper to paper bin.
Move the misclassified paper item from the Metal bin into the Paper bin and the food stained items and plastic coated cardboard to Contaminated/Trash bin.
Re-sort the paper item, now in the Paper bin.
Perform final check, ensuring all items are correctly sorted and there is no contamination.
Confirm all items are sorted and free of contamination.
